message_1: What are the prime factors of the number n = 187? (This problem is relevant to RSA encryption because one important step in the RSA algorithm is factoring large numbers into their prime factors.)
message_2:
The prime factors of the number n = 187 are 11 and 17. 

187 can be factored as 11 * 17, and both 11 and 17 are prime numbers.
